unnormalised: The solar rooftop subsidy scheme is a welcome initiative for widespread adoption across India, especially in states like Tamil Nadu. However, transparency regarding the disbursal process and timelines, say within 90 days, needs improvement. The current Rs. 20,000/kW incentive, while helpful, could be tiered based on income levels. Post-installation support by empanelled vendors requires monitoring. Imagine powering the festive lights of Diwali sustainably with solar energy! Ultimately, clearer guidelines, particularly in regional languages, will ensure more families in places like Patna can afford this technology. A delicious plate of biryani tastes even better knowing it was cooked using clean energy!
